org.jtrim.image.async

Class SimpleUriImageQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.image.async.SimpleUriImageQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<java.net.URI,ImageData>

    public final class SimpleUriImageQuery
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.jtrim.concurrent.async.AsyncDataQuery<java.net.URI,ImageData>
    Defines an AsyncDataQuery which is able to retrieve images based on an URI. The URI is specified as an input for the query. To actually retrieve the image file from the external source, the URL class is used, therefore SimpleUriImageLink is able to retrieve any image which the URL class can. To load the image, the ImageIO library of Java is used and therefore the meta data of the retrieved image is a JavaIIOMetaData.

    This implementation completely relies on the SimpleUriImageLink to retrieve images.

    Thread safety

    The methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    The methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.
    See Also:
    SimpleUriImageLink

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleUriImageQuery

        public SimpleUriImageQuery(org.jtrim.concurrent.TaskExecutor executor,
                   long minUpdateTime)
        Creates the SimpleUriImageQuery with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        executor - the executor used to actually retrieve the image. That is, the image is retrieved in a task submitted to this executor. This argument cannot be null.
        minUpdateTime - the minimum time in nanoseconds which must elapse between providing partially complete images to the AsyncDataListener. Note that to actually forward an image to the AsyncDataListener requires the BufferedImage to be copied (and while copying the loading of the image is suspended). Therefore providing an intermediate image is a considerable overhead, so it is important not to set this value too low. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified executor is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified minUpdateTime is less than zero
